summary: Marxism is a way of understanding how society works and changes, focusing on the struggles between different social classes. It was developed by German thinkers Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels in the 1800s. Marxism believes that history is shaped by economic and social forces, and it aims to create a more equal society. Over time, it has influenced many political movements and ideas, with different groups interpreting Marx's theories in various ways. Marxism has had a big impact on many areas of study, like politics, economics, and sociology.
title: Marxism
